programme.title: DW News
programme.desc: Detailed explanations, competent analysis, coverage of world current affairs: politics, business, sport and culture. Fascinating insights beyond the headlines. Connecting the dots for viewers around the world.

programme.title: Eco India
programme.sub-title: Enhanced Farming for Better Food Security and Carbon Capture
programme.desc: Can rock weathering help to trap carbon and boost harvests in India? Plus: Europe's rare earths, water ATMs and recycled banana fibres.

programme.title: Tomorrow Today
programme.sub-title: Mosquitos and climate change - research into peatlands
programme.desc: This time it is all about mosquitos! We travel to restored peatlands in Germany, where researchers are studying populations of different species, and look behind the scenes in labs studying the insects.

programme.title: Planet A
programme.sub-title: The real reason we can't seem to ban plastic
programme.desc: A ban on plastics seems like an obvious measure to avoid waste. But do the EU-wide bans deliver on their promises?

programme.title: Close Up
programme.desc: In-depth analysis and reporting on topical political issues and newsworthy events that are happening all over the world.

programme.title: Shift
programme.sub-title: How dangerous are TikTok & Co. for democracy?
programme.desc: Online radicalisation is splitting whole societies. Many blame social media and AI algorithms. Are these platforms becoming a danger to democracy itself?

programme.title: The 77 Percent
programme.sub-title: Long Street Debate: South Africa USAID Pullback
programme.desc: Could Africa's greatest opportunity come from a funding crisis? As USAID pulls back, the stage is set for a high-stakes debate at the Human Rights Festival. Young minds discuss whether the continent will become less dependent on American aid funding.
